t: Isaiah 32
Behold,*p a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in judgment.
And*p a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place, as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.
And*p the eyes of them that see shall not be dim, and the ears of them that hear shall hearken.
The*p heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.
The*p vile person shall be no more called liberal, nor the churl said to be bountiful.

For*p the vile person will speak villany, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise hypocrisy, and to utter error against the Lord,*s to make empty the soul of the hungry, and he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
The*p instruments also of the churl are evil: he deviseth wicked devices to destroy the poor with lying words, even when the needy speaketh right.
But*p the liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand.
Rise*p up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless daughters; give ear unto my speech.
Many*p days and years shall ye be troubled, ye careless women: for the vintage shall fail, the gathering shall not come.
Tremble,*p ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless ones: strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins.
They*p shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
Upon*p the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; yea, upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:
Because*p the palaces shall be forsaken; the multitude of the city shall be left; the forts and towers shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;
Until*p the spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness be a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted for a forest.
Then*p judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field.
And*p the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance for ever.
And*p my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places;
When*p it shall hail, coming down on the forest; and the city shall be low in a low place.
Blessed*p are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth thither the feet of the ox and the ass.
